    • Method Detail

      • getInputStream

        public static final java.io.InputStream getInputStream(java.lang.String path)
        Creates an input stream of an file in the Jar file The path have to start
        with an '/' otherwise we add it! You can use this formats:

        "/path/image.png"
        "path/image.png"
        "path\\image.png"
        "\\path\\image.png"

         Bold is default
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the inner source
        Returns:
        the input stream to the path file

      • getInputStream

        public static final java.io.InputStream getInputStream(java.lang.String pack,
                                                       java.lang.String filename)
        Creates an input stream of an file in the Jar file.
        The package uses '.' as file seperator have to start with an '/' otherwise we add it!
        You can use this formats:

        "com.niton.sources", "image.png"
        "com/niton/sources", "image.png"
        "com\\niton\\sources", "image.png"
        "\\com\\niton\\sources", "image.png"
        "/com/niton/sources", "image.png"

         Bold is default
        Parameters:
        pack - the Java package the file is included in
        filename - the name of the file itsself
        Returns:
        the input stream to the path file

        Returns:
        the object of the data
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error reading/writing in streams

      • copyFromJar

        public static void copyFromJar(NFile target,
                               java.lang.String source)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        Copy a file from the JAR to the hard disk.
        Reading and writing byte-wise.
        Only use '/' no '\' and not use '.'
        Parameters:
        target - the target where the file should be saved at
        source - the name of the resource (have to be an file) starting with an '/'
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if something went wrong during copying

      • getImage

        public static javax.swing.ImageIcon getImage(java.lang.String path)
        Reads an image icon at the path
        OUT OF THE JAR
        To read a image from the Hard Disk use: 
         IconImage imageFromDisk = getImage(new NFile(path));
        Parameters:
        path - the inner absolute path of the image
        Returns:
        the read image or null on Error/Exception

      • getImage

        public static javax.swing.ImageIcon getImage(NFile file)
        Reads an image from the Hard Disk.
        Do not throw any exception. Returns null instead.
        Parameters:
        file - the NFile on the Disk to read from
        Returns:
        the read Image or null on error such as FileNotFoundException

      • getImage

        public static javax.swing.ImageIcon getImage(java.lang.String path,
                                             boolean inJar,
                                             int width,
                                             int height)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Reads an image optional from the hard disk or from the jar.
        This method do NOT defines the location of the image by the path.
        It returns an scaled instance of the image by given width and height.
        Do not use negative values.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the Image
        inJar - true if the file is located in the jar file (in the project)
        width - the width the image is scaled to in px
        height - the height the image is scaled to in px
        Returns:
        the scaled instance of the Image
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - any error is thrown even NullPointerException

      • getImage

        public static javax.swing.ImageIcon getImage(java.lang.String path,
                                             boolean inJar,
                                             double scale)
                                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Reads an image optional from the hard disk or from the jar.
        This method do NOT defines the location of the image by the path.
        It returns an scaled instance of the image by given the scale factor.
        Do not use negative values.
        Parameters:
        path - the path to the Image
        inJar - true if the file is located in the jar file (in the project)
        scale - the factor which is used as height*scale and width*scale
        Returns:
        the scaled instance of the Image
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - any error is thrown even NullPointerException

      • scaleImage

        public static java.awt.Image scaleImage(java.awt.Image original,
                                        int width,
                                        int height)
        Scales the image to the width and height
        Parameters:
        original - the image to scale
        width - the new width of the image
        height - the new height of the image
        Returns:
        the scaled instance

      • scaleImage

        public static java.awt.Image scaleImage(java.awt.Image original,
                                        double factor)
        Scales the image by the scale Factor
        Parameters:
        original - the image to scale
        factor - the factor to multiply with (1 = original size) (2 = double size) and 0.5 is half size
        Returns:
        the scaled instance
